abstract: Rescuers continue to pull survivors from piles of twisted metal and chunks of concrete after major earthquake devastates eastern Turkey; emergency workers raise questions about the quality of building construction in the area, which is officially designated as earthquake prone, as they observe some completely intact buildings next door to structures that are completely destroyed.
snippet: More than 30 people, including a newborn baby girl, have been pulled alive from the rubble in a region of Turkey that was hit by an earthquake on Sunday.
lead_paragraph: More than 30 people, including a newborn baby girl, have been pulled alive from the rubble in a region of Turkey that was hit by an earthquake on Sunday.

headline.main: Amid Debris in Turkey, Survivors and Signs of Poor Construction
headline.print_headline: Amid Debris in Turkey, Survivors and Signs of Poor Construction
headline.seo: Turkey Quake Victims Rescued From Rubble
